meanings.definition: The basic monetary unit of Greece before the adoption of the euro.
meanings.sent1: In ancient times, people in Greece used drachmas to buy things.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for drachmas when I visited Greece.
meanings.sent3: The shopkeeper chuckled as the customer tried to pay with drachmas from centuries ago.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was worth more than a thousand drachmas in my eyes.
meanings.sent5: The glint of the drachmas in the merchant's hand caught my attention.

meanings.definition: A unit of weight in ancient Greece, equivalent to about 4.37 grams.
meanings.sent1: The jeweler measured the gemstone in drachmas to determine its value.
meanings.sent2: The recipe called for a drachma of saffron to add flavor to the dish.
meanings.sent3: The drachma on the scale seemed to tip the balance in the merchant's favor.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as light as a drachma in the palm of my hand.
meanings.sent5: The drachma of wisdom she shared with me was priceless.

meanings.definition: A coin of ancient Greece, originally made of a silver alloy.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed ancient drachmas minted with intricate designs.
meanings.sent2: Collectors sought after rare drachmas to complete their coin collections.
meanings.sent3: The child pretended to be a wealthy merchant, tossing drachmas in the air.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a shiny drachma in the midst of a dull day.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the drachmas clinking together was music to his ears.
